jobs.descriptionHtml:
Machine Learning Engineer at LMArena

Location: SF Bay Area/Remote

Type: Full-Time

About the Role:

LMArena is seeking a Senior Machine Learning Engineer to help scale and strengthen the core infrastructure that powers real-world AI evaluation. You’ll play a foundational role in shaping how we build, deploy, and improve our model benchmarking systems, working across data pipelines, inference APIs, and new evaluation methodologies. This is an opportunity to apply your technical expertise to a platform trusted by millions, and to help define how cutting-edge AI is assessed in the wild.

As one of the first ML engineers on the team, you’ll partner closely with researchers, engineers, and product leadership to turn new ideas into reliable systems. You’ll help us move fast while staying rigorous, improving reproducibility, scaling up to new modalities, and deepening our ability to understand and compare frontier models.

Responsibilities:

  • Architect and build what will become our core modeling for data and evaluation products

  • Own the full stack data, model training, and eval pipelines

  • Help grow a culture of feedback and rapid product iteration as we build new features as a tight-nit team

  • Conduct research into state-of-the-art evaluation methods and contribute to the long-term vision for a centralized, scalable evaluation platform.

Who is LMArena?

Created by researchers from UC Berkeley’s SkyLab, LMArena is an open platform where everyone can easily access, explore and interact with the world’s leading AI models. By comparing them side by side and casting votes for the better response, the community helps shape a public leaderboard, making AI progress more transparent, and grounded in real-world usage.

Why Join Us?

Trusted by organizations like Google, OpenAI, Meta, xAI, and more, LMArena is rapidly becoming essential infrastructure for transparent, human-centered AI evaluation at scale. With over one million monthly users and growing developer adoption, our impact is helping guide the next generation of safe, aligned AI systems—grounded in open access and collective feedback.

Our work is regularly referenced by industry leaders pushing the frontier of safe and reliable AI. Sundar Pichai, Jeff Dean, Elon Musk, and Sam Altman.

  • High Impact: Your work will be used daily by the world’s most advanced AI labs.

  • Global Reach: Develop data infrastructure powering millions of real-world evaluations, influencing AI reliability across industries at the top-tier

  • Exceptional Team: We are a small team of top talent from Google, DeepMind, Discord, Vercel, UC Berkeley, and Stanford.

Requirements:

  • Strong programming skills with the ability to work across the stack in a typical recommendation system or LLM stack

  • Experience in deep learning, language models or reward model training

  • Experience in working with LLM for fine tuning, prompt engineering, function calling etc

  • Self-motivated with a willingness to take ownership of tasks

  • A passion for shipping quality products

  • 4+ years of industry experience or relevant projects

  • Solid understanding of statistics, and various tools and methodologies for evaluating uncertainty in a way that is specific to the given product being shipped

What we offer:

  • 210k - 250k + equity. Actual compensation will depend on job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and candidate location.

  • Competitive salary and meaningful equity

  • Comprehensive healthcare coverage (medical, dental, vision)

  • The opportunity to work on cutting-edge AI with a small, mission-driven team

  • A culture that values transparency, trust, and community impact

Come help build the space where anyone can explore and help shape the future of AI.

Enterprise Engineer

Location:  San Francisco, California

Job Type:  Full Time

Reports To: Head of Enterprise Security & Engineering

About the Company

LMArena is an engineering-first startup redefining how the world evaluates large language models. Created in 2023 by UC Berkeley researchers, our neutral, community-driven benchmarking platform attracts over one million monthly users—pairwise comparing leading models from OpenAI, Google, Anthropic, and more—to deliver real-time insights into the rapidly evolving LLM landscape. LMArena is scaling fast to build the next generation of AI testing infrastructure and set the industry standard for model evaluation.

This Enterprise Engineer will be the tip of the spear on a small team that owns end-to-end IT, identity & access, device management, SaaS application management and security, and drive a culture of security best practices. This is a deeply hands-on role—you’ll be setting up systems yourself, while also defining policies and vendor relationships that will scale as we grow.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Identity & Access Management + SaaS Estate Management

    • Support user onboarding/offboarding via Okta (SCIM, Okta Workflows)

    • Experience with Okta Workflows, or similar low/no-code API automation tooling (n8n, zapier, etc)

    • Enforce MFA using FIDO2 hardware keys, and assist with key enrollments (Yubikeys)

    • Experience with Okta Identity Governance, or similar idP governance solutions

    • Familiar with SaaS lifecycle management reporting and automation tools (ie automate reporting and remediation of unused SaaS licenses across SaaS estate)

    • Comfortable troubleshooting authentication policies, global session policies, and device assurance policies within Okta

    • Experience with group rules (to manage birthright access) and group based permissions. 

  • Email and Collaboration Suite

    • Assist with Google Workspace administration (management of user, group, OU, email, and Drive sharing/permissions)

    • Help with file sharing (Google Drive) organization and collaboration by ensuring that all internal/external sharing follows the principle of least privilege. 

    • Comfortable troubleshooting email delivery issues (GWS email reporting, DNS Authentication: SPF/DKIM/DMARC, Postmaster Tools)

    • Adept at using GWS’ investigation tool to investigate sign-in logs, o-auth logs, API logs, etc

    • Experience with Chrome browser and Chrome web store management

    • Familiar with GWS API controls and are able to configure and manage 3rd-party app access following the principles of least privilege. 

  • Network and A/V Infrastructure

    • Comfortable troubleshooting basic networking and connectivity issues

    • Can assist in the configuration and troubleshooting of remote connectivity for remote workers (VPN, SSE, SASE)

    • Familiar with Zoom, Teams, and Google Meet platforms, and can support Zoom Room, Teams Room, and Meet Room in-office deployments

    • Ensure secure, reliable connectivity for both remote and on-site employees

    • Assist with visitor-badge systems and hybrid-work connectivity

  • Endpoint, MDM, and EDR

    • Assist in the creation and management of MDM device configurations and compliance policies 

    • Comfortable with Windows, macOS, iOS, and Android MDM enrollment and management

    • Knowledge of BYOD management and full management strategies, including Android (work/school profiles) and iOS’ account-drive user enrollment

    • Experience with deployment and management of Crowdstrike Falcon: USB device control, discovery module, and exposure management

    • Manage OS and 3rd party patching

    • Assist with the deployment and management of Okta Device Assurance policies (dynamic SCEP/device certificates) to ensure that only compliant devices (screen lock, encryption, password, fully patched) are able to access applications integrated with Okta.  

  • Security Operations and Vendor Management 

    • Assist the Head of Enterprise Security with vendor selection, procurement, and day-to-day engagement for all IT/security tools

    • Monitor and respond to security incidents while establishing proactive defenses to  prevent future breaches

    • Partner with the Head of Enterprise Security to develop, deploy, and enforce security policies (acceptable use, incident response runbooks

What We’re Looking For

Required:

  • ~3-5 years of combined IT + security experience

  • Proven “startup-scrappy” mindset: hands-on with device builds, scripting, troubleshooting—and comfortable wearing many hats

  • Deep practical experience with Okta (SCIM, SSO), Google Workspace administration, and hardware-key MFA (YubiKey/FIDO2)

  • Solid track record deploying MDM/endpoint tooling and EDR (e.g. CrowdStrike) in mixed environments

  • Passion for Enterprise Engineering and Security as evidenced by personal projects, home-labbing

  • Excellent communicator who can engage directly with executives, engineers, and external partners

Highly Desirable:

  • Prior experience in a high-growth SaaS startup

  • Hands-on network and A/V build-out experience (wired/wireless, PoE, badge systems)

  • Familiarity with security frameworks or compliance (SOC 2, ISO 27001 readiness)

  • Bachelor’s in Information Systems, MIS, Computer Science, or related field

Why You’ll Love It Here:

  • Impact & Ownership: As the company’s first Enterprise Engineering hire, you will have the ability to shape the role and help contribute to a start-up at the “ground-floor”

  • Fast-paced Growth: Work closely with founders, see your initiatives roll out immediately, and scale with us.

  • Autonomy: Pick the tools and vendors you trust; we’ll support you with budget and a seasoned consulting partner.

  • Hybrid Flexibility: Remote-first environment with a new office coming online—shape our office experience.

What we offer:

  • The cash compensation for this position has not yet been finalized. Actual compensation will depend on job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and candidate location.

  • Competitive salary and meaningful equity

  • Comprehensive healthcare coverage (medical, dental, vision)

  • The opportunity to work on cutting-edge AI with a small, mission-driven team

  • A culture that values transparency, trust, and community impact

Come help build the space where anyone can explore and help shape the future of AI.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer, Data Infrastructure
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Software Engineer, Data Infrastructure at LMArena

Location: SF Bay Area/Remote

Type: Full-Time

About the Role:

LMArena is seeking a Software Engineer to join our team and build the data infrastructure that powers real-world AI evaluation. You'll play a crucial role in designing and building the data pipelines that process and analyze over 3 millions user vote data, directly impacting how we understand and evaluate AI model performance. This role is ideal for someone who thrives in fast-moving environments and interested in building products to ensure accurate and fair evaluation of human preferences across different models, which will shape the direction of future AI development.

As an early member of our data engineering team, you'll partner closely with researchers, engineers, and product leadership to retrieve valuable data and insights from human votes and feedback. You'll help us move fast while staying rigorous, improving data quality, scaling our infrastructure to new levels, and deepening our ability to compare frontier models and predict human preferences.

Responsibilities:

  • Design and build robust data pipelines to ingest, process, and transform user vote data to features essential for model performance evaluation.

  • Collaborate with researchers and product leadership to understand product goals and necessary data.

  • Design and implement solutions to generate result dashboards and reports, providing useful information for the public, model providers, and researchers.

  • Ensure the integrity, data quality, and reliability of the pipelines.

  • Scale our data infrastructure to accommodate increasing data volumes and evolving analytical needs.

Who is LMArena?

Created by researchers from UC Berkeley’s SkyLab, LMArena is an open platform where everyone can easily access, explore and interact with the world’s leading AI models. By comparing them side by side and casting votes for the better response, the community helps shape a public leaderboard, making AI progress more transparent, and grounded in real-world usage.

Why Join Us?

Trusted by organizations like Google, OpenAI, Meta, xAI, and more, LMArena is rapidly becoming essential infrastructure for transparent, human-centered AI evaluation at scale. With over one million monthly users and growing developer adoption, our impact is helping guide the next generation of safe, aligned AI systems—grounded in open access and collective feedback.

Our work is regularly referenced by industry leaders pushing the frontier of safe and reliable AI. Sundar Pichai, Jeff Dean, Elon Musk, and Sam Altman.

  • High Impact: Your work will be used daily by the world’s most advanced AI labs.

  • Global Reach: Develop data infrastructure powering millions of real-world evaluations, influencing AI reliability across industries at the top-tier

  • Exceptional Team: We are a small team of top talent from Google, DeepMind, Discord, Vercel, UC Berkeley, and Stanford.

Requirements:

  • Strong software engineering background with a dedicated focus on data engineering and big data technologies.

  • Proficiency in SQL and at least one programming language commonly used for data analysis (Python (preferred), Scala, R).

  • Hands-on experience with data processing and pipeline frameworks (Apache Spark, Ray Data, etc.) and at least one popular big data analytics platform (Databricks, Snowflake).

  • Demonstrated experience in designing, implementing, optimizing, and debugging production data pipelines.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Prior work in data analytics or datalake platforms.

  • Experience in advanced data analysis tools, such as Delta lake, streaming tables.

  • Exposure to machine learning is a plus.

What we offer:

  • 210k - 250k + equity. Actual compensation will depend on job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and candidate location.

  • Competitive salary and meaningful equity

About the Role:

LMArena is seeking a variety of Machine Learning Scientist to help advance how we evaluate and understand AI models. Your work will contribute to the scientific foundations of understanding AI at scale.

Your work will inform both the public leaderboard and the tools we provide to model developers.

If you’re excited by open-ended questions, rigorous evaluation, and research that’s grounded in real-world impact, you’ll find a meaningful home here. We’re looking for:

About the Role

LMArena is seeking a Senior Infrastructure Engineer to define, build, and evolve the technical foundations that power the world’s most transparent AI evaluation platform. This is not just an architecture role - you’ll partner directly with product, security, and data teams to identify bottlenecks, design resilient systems, and ship the code that keeps our platform fast, reliable, and secure at scale.

You’ll have a broad impact across the stack: optimizing performance, building primitives that accelerate feature delivery, hardening our systems against abuse, and scaling infrastructure to handle billions of API requests and real-time votes. If you love working across boundaries, getting deep into code, and making infrastructure a product in its own right, this is the role for you.

Responsibilities

  • Own technical strategy for LMArena’s core infrastructure - networking, APIs, services, data systems, and security foundations.

  • Design and implement high-performance systems that scale to hundreds of millions of real-time interactions and evaluations per day.

  • Collaborate with security engineering to embed anti-abuse measures, Sybil resistance, and trust systems into core platform architecture.

  • Partner with product engineering to deliver infrastructure improvements that directly accelerate feature velocity and reliability.

  • Build developer-facing primitives and tooling—internal APIs, SDKs, CI/CD enhancements—that make our platform more productive and safe to build on.

  • Monitor, profile, and optimize system performance across backend services, databases, and networking layers.

  • Drive operational excellence through observability, capacity planning, and incident response best practices.

jobs.title: Technical Recruiter
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the role

LMArena is hiring a highly collaborative Technical Recruiter to help scale a world-class team. You’ll serve as a trusted advisor to candidates and hiring leaders, build repeatable recruiting practices, advance inclusive hiring, support employer brand efforts, and deliver an outstanding candidate experience.

What you’ll do

  • Partner with hiring managers to clarify role outcomes, success profiles, and interview plans; prioritize reqs against business goals.

  • Run full-cycle recruiting: kickoff → JD refinement → sourcing → assessment → debriefs → offer → close.

  • Build pipelines via targeted sourcing (passive outreach, talent communities, events, referrals, and thoughtful job posts).

  • Maintain a structured, fair process: define competencies, calibrate rubrics, and uphold a consistent candidate experience.

  • Hold a relentless drive for excellence in every stage—calibrating rubrics, tightening loops, and continuously improving the funnel.

  • Track and improve funnel health (speed, quality, diversity signals); report weekly and quarterly progress with clear narrative and metrics.

  • Drive offer strategy and negotiations aligned to leveling, compensation bands, and market insights.

  • Nurture long-term networks of high-potential talent; keep a mapped bench for critical and future roles.

  • Partner on employer brand moments (events, content, communities) that attract deep-tech talent.

  • Coach hiring managers and interviewers on best practices and candidate excellence.

What you’ll bring

  • 10+ years of full-cycle technical recruiting in deep-tech environments.

  • Proven strength sourcing and closing passive candidates for high-bar roles; skilled at narrative selling and objection handling.

  • Demonstrated ability to translate business needs into clear hiring plans, profiles, and processes.

  • Experience collaborating across functions and influencing stakeholders at pace.

  • Expertise at hiring across a range of technical skill sets.

  • Fluency with structured interviewing, competency rubrics, and recruiting analytics

  • Commitment to inclusive hiring and candidate experience.

  • A relentless drive for excellence—raising the bar on candidate quality, process rigor, and stakeholder experience.
